title: Social Physics-Balloon Challenge
description: Catalyst lacks the ability to create "value" to engage community members. We are also challenged with defining "value".

assessments.note: The proposal addresses the challenge of raising awareness of the objective of defining value by creative incentives. For a fully decentralized governance I do think all of ideas should be exhibited, highly discussed and defined by the proposer, experts, advisor and the community. And funding is done both by the project treasury and those who find value in the project as a form of crowdsourcing. At the end of the day it works in the community best interest that projects developed/launched at Cardano are properly executed and that the results improve the community at large. Value can be possibly created on more specialized challenges in the the top-down level. Where ideas come from a more detailed challenge for each fund cycle that focuses on X goal rather than generalized focus. These focuses on value could be created using this proposal's format.
it's not clear what's being proposed at all

The proposal describes setups that might be profiting to find a meaningful outcome. This sounds like an interesting approach in addition to the currently used catalyst process. But there are many things left undescribed. How are the topics of these challenges choosen. Will there be a platform for the implementation of this idea. Because of the many things that are unclear, I have my doubts regarding the effectivness to address the challenge.

The proposer is suggestion to implement findings and mechanics of DARPA's Red Balloon Challenge in order to reorganize and restructure Catalyst community into groups. This should encourage more interception of ideas, crossover and flow of information.

I must admit I am not familiar with some of the concepts presented in this proposal and I hope this admission does not disqualify my assessment nor invalidate it somehow. But I am approaching this with the open mind of an ignorant voter who might see this proposal in Catalyst who is seeking my vote. To me this proposal is almost existential in its presentation of the challenge and of the solution. I failed to make a connection between the DARPA red balloon and the Catalyst Value Onboarding. Its assignation of 'value' and in the same breadth question its meaning somewhat contradicts the solution before it even begins. I guess I am justifying my score by stating I was lost in absorbing the solution and making the connection to improving Catalyst value. If I am penalised for that, so be it.

financially self-sustainable network and
Profits realized by the business are reinvested in the business itself (or used to start other social businesses networking), with the aim of increasing social impact, for example expanding the company's reach, improving the products or services or in other ways subsidizing the social mission.
Unlike a profit-maximizing business, the prime aim of a social network business is not to maximize profits (although generating profits is desired). Furthermore, business owners are not receiving any dividend out of the business profits, if any.

On the other hand, unlike a non-profit, a social business is not dependent on donations or on private or public grants to survive and to operate, because, as any other business, it is self-sustainable. Furthermore, unlike a non-profit, where funds are spent only once on the field, funds in a social business are invested to increase and improve the business' operations on the field on an indefinite basis. Per Yunus' quote: "A charity dollar has only one life; a social business dollar can be invested over and over again."

It appears that a similar framework that has being used serve as inspiration for a working solution to the defined problem. More clarity as to a roadmap with an end goal could be delineated to assess it potential execution.
there is no plan.. the proposer is asking for funds to sent independently which is highly inappropriate

I miss specifics and therefore it is hard to assess the prospects of success. As it is primary a social problem to be successful in suche setup, a Independent Academic with a focus on social behavior, social networks, a collective intelligence might work. It would help to get information, if the author of the idea has specific experience in this setup.

The proposer claims to be a an independent academic with experience in social behaviors and networks. Given their experience they will be able to handle this project with additional outsourcing when needed.

Assuming I did 'get it' and am on-board with the impact of this proposal, it only presents a general plan on the activities and the 'challenges' that will solve the problem and provide value to Catalyst. The proposal lacks an itemisation of how such a challenge can be conducted, the delivery models considered and how it can be organised, and an explanation of how the budget will be spent, and of the timelines of the event. Examination of the information in the urls does not link to any examples of previous challenges conducted nor any experiences in running such an event.

Philosophically, social network business is based on what identifies as the two basic motives of human beings, desires and financial ,stability, people do seek profit through business; however, social Network is also based on the latter motive people by performing philanthropic services, like establishing churches, mosques, synagogues, art museums, public parks, health clinics or community centers. the profits made through a social Networking operations are less important than the beneficial effects it has on focus society.study, learning,support,skills and invest in young social Networks
It has a clear focus, pool of expertise and clear vision backed by already working framework.
The budget would be used to award teams who won the challenge, but it's not clear what the challenge are and how they are related to Cardano.
Few specific on the realisation part. It presents more a concept than a specific project.

The proposal could benefit from an explanation on what they are referring to and what the successful product will look like, a list of KPIs would be welcome as well as an approximate timeline. Also funds requested are in ADA and not USD and has not been corrected prior to this assessment.

As a concept, which I honestly do not understand, there is a disconnect between the challenge and the solution which fails to align to the goals of Cardano and Project Catalyst. The proposal will need to elaborate further and perhaps make an assumption on its own definition of 'value' before it can justify its solution will improve the said value. The approach to the solution is in a general state and is too high level. Greater detail is required in terms of the tools it will use to run the challenge, the logistics of the event, and its timelines and the justification of the funding it is seeking.
